definition: the walls have ears (idiom)
to separate/to partition/to stand or lie between/at a distance from/after or at an interval of
wall/CL:面[mian4],堵[du3]
variant of 牆|墙[qiang2], wall
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
ear/handle (archaeology)/and that is all (Classical Chinese)

sentences.english: The walls have ears , you know.
sentences.chinese: 小声点，你知道，隔墙有耳。

sentences.english: Hedges have eyes, and walls have ears.
Not so loud. Walls have ears.
Shall I come to your hotel? Better if we meet in the Park. Walls have ears.
sentences.chinese: 我来你的饭店吗？隔墙有耳，最好我们在公园里碰面。

sentences.english: Don't you know that even the walls have ears?
sentences.chinese: 你难道不知道隔墙有耳吗？

definition: to eavesdrop/to monitor (secretly)
walls have ears
Trouble issues from the mouth (idiom). A loose tongue may cause a lot of trouble.
if you say too much, you're bound to slip up at some point (idiom)
to divulge secrets
lit. easy to dodge the spear in the open, hard to avoid a stab in the dark (idiom); it is hard to guard against secret conspiracies
pinyin: ming2 qiang1 yi4 duo3 , an4 jian4 nan2 fang2

definition: to speak cautiously/to guard one's tongue
casual conversation/chat/gossip/to talk about (whatever comes to mind)
stir up the fire and you get burnt (idiom); to get one's fingers burnt/fig. to suffer on account of one's own meddling
talkative/to speak out of turn/to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/rumors fly
If you don't want anyone to know, don't do it (idiom). fig. If you do something bad, people will inevitably hear about it.
pinyin: ruo4 yao4 ren2 bu4 zhi1 , chu2 fei1 ji3 mo4 wei2
related.word: 若要人不知，除非己莫为

definition: to talk intimately while being comparative strangers (idiom)
hard to fathom a person's mind (idiom)
see 言多必失[yan2 duo1 bi4 shi1]
to eavesdrop/to listen in secret to sb's conversations
there is no knowing what is in a man's heart (idiom)
